website_summaries.verdict: Full-size, solid wood, hand-carved maple wood top, this adult’s viola includes a proper, genuine horsehair bow. Decent quality instrument for an attractive price
pros: In addition to the inclusion of the case, bow and rosin, they also include an extra bridge, which we like
It’s available in different colors as well, making it a fun choice (note – different colors may result in slightly different sound)
More cost-effective than a long-term rental instrument
cons: Colors may not match exactly as pictured
Improper assembly may require strings to be tightened more frequently

customer_reviews.title: He loves it
customer_reviews.text: My sons instrument teacher told us not to purchase one off the internet. They wanted us to go to a music store and rent one that in the end would have totaled 800. After much research I decided on this particular viola and she couldn't tell the difference!!! It works great. It came with extra strings, a nice case and it sounds great
customer_reviews.author: Yaya

customer_reviews.title: Decent Instrument for a Beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is a beginner's Viola. It came pre-strung and with backup strings which was nice. It's a beautiful instrument. My 1 dislike is the bow was horrible. There were many hairs that were disconnected when we opened the box. Very disappointed with that particular condition.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this instrument for my daughter as she is just learning so I didn't want to invest a great deal of money. To serve the purpose its..."fine". The sound quality etc. is completely sufficient but the biggest issue is the tuning pegs are only held in with friction and as such the instrument becomes out of tune very easily and is difficult to put back into tune. If I had realized this would be an ongoing issue I would have paid a couple of hundred dollars instead so that there would be some higher quality tuning pegs.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great job on this
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the reviews on this one and was prepared to return it or buy another. My son is only a second year player and is new to playing. However, he loved this instrument. He plays it 30-60 minutes everyday as required by the teacher. He loves playing it and peyote are always interested in it. No issues except one very minor one. The back of the neck was not painted like the rest of the viola. It was left wood colored. No big deal, just odd. Update. My son recently stated the zipper broke after a couple uses. It has two and still works.
customer_reviews.author: The guy that shops online

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality and Craftmanship
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know anything about viola and the price. So I bought this and took it to my daughter's orchestra teacher. She inspected it and laughed. I felt embarassed. She said it was a low quality and craftsmanship. She went into details but I forgot what she said. She didn't allow my daughter to use it and suggested other brands that have better quality. So I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Vieth79

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.text: Just remember, "you get what you pay for." For the price it's great! Great for someone who just wants to learn to play. Not the sound or quality for someone trying to make playing anything more than just a hobby. If you are this product is great for learning, just upgrade later. Shipping was rough. Package came in rough shape. Just a small crack on the actual instrument.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent VIOLA for an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: First and most important this is an actual VIOLA not a violin. Present for a 12yr old student. This pleased a tween with high standards. Came with everything but a shoulder rest (get the shoulder rest, it allows the instrument better sound). Beautiful instrument. If you get the instrument in the winter, PLEASE allow it to fully reach room temperature and adjust to the humidity before attempting to tune. If you can be patient, it will tune easily and sound just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Velvadena Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad or nothing good just a normal viola. I mean did come with an extra set of strings which was needed when I accidentally broke one of them trying to tune the viola. Came with extremely loose strings which I was warned so it was okay. Also when it came some of the bow hairs got stuck on the twisty lock thing to keep the bow in place so when I took the bow out is broke some of the strings.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Might be ok if you've never held a decent quality viola...not super comfortable to play and really thin wood. Constantly out of tune, but was good tuning practice for my daughter. Silver linings? Not agreeing with the good reviews that prompted my purchase, but probably should have done much more research before buying. Oopsies.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli M.

customer_reviews.title: Great instrument for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a blast with this. My first viola and haven't played any others. As far as I can tell it is built well, looks and sounds good. For the price, I don't see how anyone could complain. Bottom line, I'm making noise with it and having a blast learning how to play it.
customer_reviews.author: RedDog001

customer_reviews.title: Great Instrument, Terrible Bow
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this viola is fantastic. The sound is surprisingly bold and it definitely deserves a 5/5. However, the bow is a different story. It took me 2 hours of applying rosin just to get the sound to come out. I would almost prefer that they put a little more quality in the bow and less quality in the instrument just so I wouldn't be so frustrated. That's why I give the bow a 2/5. Still, at this price point, it's definitely a great purchase especially for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Sun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to learn with!
customer_reviews.text: Of course its not a strad, but it works great for those learning to play. For it "not staying in tune," as with any viola, you need to push the pegs firmly into the scroll after tuning it, and fine tune it at the bottom. Im teaching my family how to play with this viola and it performs just fine for beginners. If you are just interested in learning to play, this is perfect and saves you lots of money. If you're expecting concert quality, dont be cheap, expect to pay at least 900 for a viola.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT QUALITY for this price
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT QUALITY for this price. If you child is a beginner, then this is the perfect way to go! This has worked perfectly for 2 years and I don't foresee any issues!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Moultrie

customer_reviews.title: Good student viola
customer_reviews.text: I was a student viola player in middle and high school and was good. Now I'm middle age and bored in a pandemic so I am tying again. I expected this to be really cheap and bad sound but honestly for learning all over, this is a decent student viola.
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend getting another piece of rosin because the one it ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds very smooth, the bows is alright. If you really want it to make a sound, you have to put a LOT of that rosin on it, I'd recommend getting another piece of rosin because the one it comes with seems to come off the bow very quickly. I prefer dark rosin personally. Anyways, I'm surprised this came pre-strung and ready to play (besides tuning). The black paint looks great, it has some silvery specs on it to make it look like outerspace a little bit! And the case is amazing, albeit there is no where to place a shoulder rest if you have one. Overall, great viola, I would never suspect this would be sub $100.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: More for show than performance.
customer_reviews.text: The item came well packaged & earlier than expected. The viola looked very nice and came with everything as advertised. However: 1) The tail piece is made of a metal so the sound that is produced has a "metallic" sound to it. And, 2) The thick paint/coating caused the sound to not resonate properly. 3) The tuning pegs would not stay put. They would unwind causing the Viola to have to re-tuned every few minutes. Verified by 2 professionals. After returning this product for a refund, I just decided to purchase one from that local retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Its an awesome color and an okay instrument for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Its an awesome color and an okay instrument for beginners, but the bridge is not cut or is not cut optimally, so you'd have to take it to an luthier which is a bit much for a beginning violinist. Its not "plug and play" so I don't recommend it for the absolute first time player. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: jaanarayan

customer_reviews.title: Good value, nice sound.
customer_reviews.text: I play the violin, but always wanted to play the viola as well. I didn't want to sped hundreds of dollars. This viola has great tone and looks expensive. A great value for a beginner or even a person like myself who wants to play the instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top-notch first instrument
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't wait for this to arrive and I started playing as soon as I received it. It's a sturdy, fine piece of handiwork and makes that decadent sound that we all expect for a viola. It comes with all the starting equipment that you would need (extra strings, rosin, easy instructions, etc.) Great find for beginning and intermediate violists, and probably professional as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lilka Katarzyna

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: The viola arrived with a damaged bow. The viola itself is the bottom of the barrel. If the person can play a viola or wants to learn this is not an option. Very cheaply made and not even worth the low price we paid. Should have known. Live and learn then return!
customer_reviews.author: tracysean

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for 6th grader in public school strings program. This is my first purchase of a viola as my other children both played violin. The viola arrived promptly in perfect condition. the carrying bag is great and fits all the extras that come with purchase. The only thing that has to be done was to tune the instrument, which her music teacher did with no problem. She even told her she purchased a perfect instrument for a budding musician! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: kelly l

customer_reviews.title: Great Viola for the price! Perfect for Middle/Highschool students
customer_reviews.text: If you have a kid and need a Viola, this is the one for you. My Daughter started with a smaller one back in 6th grade and now has upgraded to a larger size (she is in the 9th grade now). If you don't want to spend tons of money, yet want great sound and playability, this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: B & S Finely

customer_reviews.title: Yeaaaaaaah
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my little sister to use it in school, she loves it. Everything is expected from description and picture. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great value
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this model; my son outgrew his previous instrument. His teacher says it's "great. It tuned very easily and sounds good - a lot more depth than the 13". The fine tuners work well and the bridge is already nice and low - rare in these cheaper instruments."
customer_reviews.author: nv

customer_reviews.title: Never biying an instrument online again
customer_reviews.text: The instrument was nice enough but the bow was cheaply made and broke right away. It was more expensive to fix it or buy a new bow than to just buy a whole new instrument. My son was out of band for a bit till we could afford a new one. Will never again purchase an instrument online. We didn't have a lot of cash that's why we went with this vs. Out local stores that cost 3 times more
customer_reviews.author: cynthia zuehl

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this viola a month ago. The pegs hold the tune just fine. The viola is well made and looks beautiful. The bow included is not aligned perfectly and is beginning to warp (twist) the more I play it. However, I give this 5 stars for the instrument itself and not for the included bow and rosin. The viola is well worth the price and I would recommend this to anyone wanting a great beginner instrument. I have ordered better strings and a better bow. Completely satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a couple of months now. Did not come tuned and my child's viola teacher in his orchestra class initially told him it was a bad brand and difficult to tune. So he asked me to return it. His private lessons teacher was able to tune it for him though afterwards and since then my child has been happy using it. Time will tell if it lasts in quality or not. If it gives out, I will update this review but for now, happy with the price and product.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Spender

customer_reviews.title: The strings keep on getting messed up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my son about 3 months ago. Very cheaply made.. it's strings needs tuning every 5-10 minutes and my son dosen't know how to tune it correctly. he cant use it and now I have to buy another one. I WILL BURN IT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yener UCetin

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister as a surprise and she loved it! She was so happy. The color is great and it stands out. The bow was a little concerning. Some of the hairs weren't attached. But this one is just a practice one. Soon i'll buy her a Professional one. UPDATE: I bought this fo my sister in December and I only have one complaint... The bow is so cheap.. I mean of course, the whole thing was for a low price but the hair on the bow was already falling off from day one and then all the hairs just started falling. I understand this is just a practice kit but at least make it last!
customer_reviews.author: Lizeth

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: my daughter was so disappointed when received the originally ordered completely broken, so I ordered replacement whilst I was on travel assuming this is a fault of someone at manufacturer who damaged it while packaging however, when I actually inspected today the product when came back I had no second thoughts by just looking it that I must return the replacement even before I receive it. Don’t buy it for kido just by attractive price, product has every segment of it manufactured with poor or lowest quality I ever saw.
customer_reviews.author: Malkit Singh

customer_reviews.title: The bow is an issue!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been playing viola for almost 2 years. So instead of renting from the school I decided to buy one. The viola looks and sounds good. I had purchased the viola in the summer in hopes that my daughter would practice; she did not. At her 6th viola lesson at school her bow broke. I expected the bow to be more durable. Now I have to find a decent 3/4 bow to replace it. A week before this I was so pleased with the viola that I purchased a 14-inch viola for my other daughter. I hope this new one doesn't have issues with the bow.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst things I have seen. The bow had many broken strands, the tuning pegs for the strings we're not connected and the strings we're broken. Only good thing about this is the case it comes in which is still cheap quality. Looks like they made the instrument from a thin, cardboard type wood. Barely plays anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent instrument
customer_reviews.text: It is a beautiful instrument love the color the packaging was excellent. There were no scratches or dents it has all the extra things. My teacher tuned it for me she said it was excellent. The case is wonderful. I love playing it it has a beautiful sound. I fully recommend this viola.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: My 7yr old granddaughter has been impatiently asking for a Viola since before Christmas. We finally ordered about a week ago and she has been watching Amazon for delivery updates everyday....It finally came in today and it was perfect for her!! It was in excellent condition along with the case and bow....She is excited to start learning....Great price for a starter Viola!!
customer_reviews.author: fremontgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good tone, fun look.  Excellent service.
customer_reviews.text: This instrument for this price was spellbinding. All dimensions are accurate for learning, the sound has good quality and even the bow has good tension and resistance. My 11 year old grandson is quite the celebrity with his colored viola, and it has endured his use well. The other students liked it so much the conductor had to instruct them they could NOT paint theirs, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Masters

customer_reviews.title: Good for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: We bought this viola for my 5th grader as this is her first year in orchestra and we went sure she would stick with it. We had to buy a bridge and and chin rest for it to be comfortable and sound right. My daughter also needed another bow with a month because the original one began to break.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Garbage honestly!!
customer_reviews.text: The bow breaks with little use and is really expensive to replace. Overall the whole instrument feels very cheap and you can hear it in your music. I say spend more money and get a better instrument. Do not Buy!!! I'm returning it!!
customer_reviews.author: Rookie Malhotra

customer_reviews.title: This is not a viola
customer_reviews.text: Without knowing anything about strings instruments our daughter wanted to play the viola. We ordered this “Viola” even bought a beginning “viola” book. She got it, we tuned it she got already for her for your first music lesson and we went only to find out it was a violin!!!! Please acurately describe and ship the items you are selling...from one disappointed 10 year old
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Zacharias

customer_reviews.title: It's nice viola for beginners
customer_reviews.text: It's nice viola for beginners. I got this for my 3rd grader and she is enjoying it. Its much better than to pay monthly rental.
customer_reviews.author: Alpesh

customer_reviews.title: Value and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I have owned at least 10 violas in my lifetime, and this one delivers a good quality sound for a reasonable price. Is this a $500 instrument? Nope. But for a beginner violin/viola player this instrument works just fine. You can't really beat this deal. Renting from the school was more expensive than just purchasing this item. We are glad we bought it - everything was in excellent condition and of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kraus

customer_reviews.title: Daughter approved
customer_reviews.text: My 11 y/o is beginning her instrumental journey w. this viola. So far she has 0 complaints and it looks very nice. This was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeeniejolie

customer_reviews.title: Bad scale length, broken bow.
customer_reviews.text: Improper scale length on D, A strings even after replacing bridge and strings (see pictures). Shipped with violin strings (gauge on A string is too small). Ferrule and frog both fractured and only lasted a few hours of playing before slipping loose all hairs. Unplayable, except as a novelty toy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne K. Weinrod

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite. It is incredible that less than $90 I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought more than a dozen musical instruments from Amazon. This is my favorite . It is incredible that less than $90 I can buy such a good instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Hong Zhou

customer_reviews.title: The bridge was terrible. The pegs weren't any good and the strings ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item. The instrument wouldn't stay tuned. The bridge was terrible. The pegs weren't any good and the strings were worst. I was mad at myself, and hoped I hadn't cause my child any undue embarrassment while having this poor quality instrument in class.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice starter viola. Make sure to get it professionally set up.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Quality instrument
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our beginner. No problems with broken strings or bridge as others have had. Great value for the price. Updated: our daughter has excelled using this viola. The tightening mechanism on the bow did break and the seller sent us a new one at no charge and very promptly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bmcelhose

customer_reviews.title: Good if you're new
customer_reviews.text: I'm a violinist and was interested in playing viola and so I looked to this as an option to have one for my own to play on during the summer, as I am glad I got it for such a price, I am disappointed that the bow bends backwards when tightening to the point where I had to check if I received a baroque bow of some sort. Other than that, it is fine and playable, i mean, it's a viola under $100 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Faulty bow
customer_reviews.text: So far the viola itself is working out nicely however with just under two months of use the bow has completely fallen apart requiring a replacement so soon.
customer_reviews.author: amozzon

customer_reviews.title: Not a good thing...
customer_reviews.text: This said the product was new. The bow fell apart one of the first times we used it and the fine tuner on the tailpiece does not screw down straight. When I took this to someone to look at, they told me what a poor quality instrument it is.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rubio

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t a bad viola however I wouldn’t recommend as a starter
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This isn’t a bad viola however I wouldn’t recommend as a starter. It goes out of tune quickly and it doesn’t have the warmest tone. That could be discouraging and misleading to a new player. It works for me though because I’ve been playing for years now and I know how to deal with these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jordana

customer_reviews.title: nice instrument. the teacher said do not buy online
customer_reviews.text: nice instrument. the teacher said do not buy online. she couldn't tell I bought this online and actually said it was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Super deal for beginners! I’m sure it’s not too quality but bought it for my 10 year old to learn to play. It’s actually really decent quality! Even the case. Considering the local music stores charge a minimum of $500+ for the least expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Wright

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone just starting out!
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner viola, you cannot beat the price. The viola I received has a wonderful voice and easy playability. Very well constructed, albeit, the wood and finish are soft. I wouldn't recommend using the rosin that it comes with, you can buy a decent cake rosin for around $10. The Cecilio strings are decent, broke in quickly. Perfect for learning the basics on then I'd switch to a higher quality set. Overall, the viola I got has been an absolute joy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pegs are not good enough for the strings
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it because the strings and pegs were so low quality. Save yourself the money and go to your local music store.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica G.

customer_reviews.title: It’s black paint, not black lacquer 😮
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’11” & it’s is a concern that I was actually getting a full size (16”/ 16.5” preferably). When I received it & picked it up, it seemed a bit small. I went to a local luthier & it actually measured 15.5” I would really like to have at least a 16” viola. I’m going to look into getting an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal at discount price
customer_reviews.text: This was my cheap entry point to teaching myself how to play the viola, and I have been really happy with this deal. Initially I had a very hard time keeping it in tune, but as I broke in the instrument this issue began to resolve itself. A great deal (I got it at 62% off!) and a decent instrument for beginners who don't know any better, at the very least.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: The case is nice and is like a backpack
customer_reviews.text: Saved a lot of money buying this instead of renting a Viola from the music store for my daughters orchestra class. The case is nice and is like a backpack. My daughter loves it and it has worked flawlessly the first couple weeks of school.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Paul

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but broken
customer_reviews.text: The strings were way too tight and one broke as I was unpacking it. I literally didn't touch the string that broke. The bow strings were frayed and it was completely unusable. It cost more to fix than to buy a new one. I bought a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. The description said it is a Viola, turns out it is a Violin. Waste of money plus waste of classes that I paid for and a disappointed child
customer_reviews.author: AvidAmazoner

customer_reviews.title: Worka Great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of instrument. It's been doing its job as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sunday Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price. Student grade, but the sound it produces is rich.
customer_reviews.author: Simcha Vessason

customer_reviews.title: We loved the color and the price for the whole set
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter in 5th grade band. We loved the color and the price for the whole set! The only minor irritation is learning how to tune we had the music teacher tune it for her. But I would buy again, great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Hpartee

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful music
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it and said she had actually been looking at them for over a year. This one was her favorite! Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner to learn on
customer_reviews.text: This viola has been great for my daughter and she has had a great time learning on it. For less than the cost of a rental for the year we were able to buy my daughter a viola and she has had a blast learning to play on it.
customer_reviews.author: russianrick

customer_reviews.title: Music to my ears!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a professional instrument, but it actually sounds pretty darn good. It's beautiful to look at, and the case is nice. The resin wasn't really any good, but I replaced that for about $2 at my local music shop. Extra strings and an extra bridge are a very welcome addition. So far, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recieved with brokes of part the bow
customer_reviews.text: I got it yesterday, today I opend it, it's really nice, then I see the bow with broke of the horse hair, it is keeping tear it off the horse hair, I just wanna know what should I do now, return or can exchange another one? My son so excited for his class, and now 🙄🙄🙄,please response soonest as you can. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Santarlas

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the cheapest looking product, it looks like something you would find at a dollar store... We went to tune it and the string broke immediately. I would highly recommend NOT buying.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: It’s $100 for a reason! Don’t waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Bow was crooked. I had a profession attempt to put it all together and she struggled for 2 days with it. The strings will not stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: It's great quality and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I adore this. It's great quality and inexpensive. I am truly shocked at what a great deal it was!!!
customer_reviews.author: I shop too much

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and intacted. It sounds nice and is a beautiful shade of blue. I am satisfied with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: N.Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap product that doesn't seem beginner friendly because you need an expert to deal with all of the issues it has.
customer_reviews.author: Xiaoyu

customer_reviews.title: A good viola for beginners
customer_reviews.text: A good viola for beginners. its pretty well set up when it comes in the mail. comes wither everything you will need.
customer_reviews.author: tyson

customer_reviews.title: The viola itself is perfectly fine to play if tuned correctly
customer_reviews.text: The viola itself is perfectly fine to play if tuned correctly, but the bow could be better. It's kind of cheap and has loose horsehair. The rosen also broke as soon as opened, but overall the entire set is a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet

customer_reviews.title: poor item
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality Does not tune Bridge falls off all the time
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Of all the brands we've tried, this is by far the easiest to install.
customer_reviews.text: This sounded way better than the $800 viola we rented.
customer_reviews.author: edc

customer_reviews.title: Restring violin
customer_reviews.text: First day of school both orchestra teachers said that there is something wrong with it. Apparently, It was a re-string Violin so we had to return it to get a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Far.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good starter Viola
customer_reviews.text: It's a good starter Viola, this is our second one as my son outgrew the first one and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Harraka

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister. She likes it, it looks nice, and it came very well packaged. Comes with rosin, and extra strings. We did have to attach the bridge ourselves, and tuning was a little hard because the pegs kept sliding. Might need to buy something else for that issue. Overall, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Instrument
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of the instrument. My granddaughter was very surprised by her gift. My choir director helped to pick out the instruments I purchased since I am not familiar with them. He was very impressed by the extras included.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: I was worried because the price seemed too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: I was worried because the price seemed too good to be true. It has been the perfect viola for a beginner. I dinged a star because the bow they sent had a cracked frog. Still, getting another bow plus the cost of this viola was still less than what the local music shops wanted for just the instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Mataya

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful viola value!
customer_reviews.text: I could hardly believe that I could get such a quality instrument at such a low price. I love it. I would like to buy more of this quality. Thank you so much, Amazon, for helping a cash-strapped mother fulfill her child's musical dreams.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Woodward-Johnson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the worst viola ever!!!!! It sounds so bad!!!!!!!!please no one is going to buy this!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Xi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and awesome sound
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality and awesome sound! Its a pretty good instrument for a beginner instrument! The sound is so deep and rich it almost makes it feel like a professional quality viola! 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Medrano

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect. Beautiful and works
customer_reviews.text: Was nervous buying without seeing it in person. It's perfect. Beautiful and works great
customer_reviews.author: Christy Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Not for advanced learners
customer_reviews.text: Returned it, very basic buid. The bridge was not setup. Our music teacher also did not like it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: and it's fine. It doesn't seem as good as my daughters ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this so I could practice with my daughter. I tried to tune it but I broke the string, so I brought it to the local music shop. They charged me $10 in NY to tune it. Every once in a while the twisty thing for the D string pops. I push it back in and tune that string again, and it's fine. It doesn't seem as good as my daughters rented viola, but maybe there are upgrades for it. This still cost me 1/3 the price of my daughters rented viola. Next year I will buy one for my daughter and get what ever upgrades there are for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa H

customer_reviews.title: A good beginner viola
customer_reviews.text: A good beginner viola. I was so happy it came in pieces and already set up! It needs tuning quite often (the C and G string sometimes go lower) I would recommend it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Lee

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 1 only because I can't give it 0. My daughter's orchestra teacher says the bridge was cut wrong. It's a useless piece of wood!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: still playing
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my daughter more than a year ago, she's still playing it. Came with everything and extras plus case. She's now well into her second year playing in her school orchestra and it has been tuned many times. Still have all the extras.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Hylton

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not what expected, the bow didnt work , it actually broke after a couple of strokes.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Hill

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because it was cheaper than renting for a year. its beautiful looking and comes with xtra stuff that makes it well worth it if your child is just starting strings. i would probably it again...as my child grows needs the next size up, i'd probably buy it again, until he/she was ready for a "full" size, then i'd buy a better grade one.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A. Salerno

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great viola, I really like the look and the sound is great, I just wish it came with a better rossin, mine broke into pieces as soon as I opened it for the first time. But not a big deal, I'm happy with my viola
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👎
customer_reviews.text: I bought a viola, but I received a violin. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Fadila

customer_reviews.title: The rosin is horrible, had to order a better quality
customer_reviews.text: This was for our son first time player. When received finger board had to be glued back into place. Very, very out of tune. The rosin is horrible, had to order a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this viola is not very high quality and sub standard for school instruction. I needed up having to rent one from our local music store.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, extra strings
customer_reviews.text: Was worth the money. Nice case, extra strings, rosin made it more of a value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy extended warranty!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the viola, but the bo was of a low quality and fell apart within a couple of months. Too bad we did not buy the extended warranty. Looks like we need to spend more than necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wongso

customer_reviews.title: great for beginning instrument
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value for a starter instrument. The rental places will charge as much over a two year period. This is a great value for what you get. Buy an extra rosin block though, this one is tiny and hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: pleasantly surprised at a very nice sounding viola. Definitely expected it to sound a lot rougher. craftsmanship of body definitely is 2nds or 3rds but the paint sparkles nicely. I would buy again. Great price for the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Danny J

customer_reviews.title: Great student viola!
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price! I ordered this viola for my son to use in his orchestra class at school. It's sturdy, and has a lovely sound. No problems at all - just needed to be tuned. My only minor complaint is that the black has sparkles in it which my son was not too thrilled about. I did not see any mention of sparkles anywhere, and the photos do not show it either. Overall, a great student viola!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mendini 16-Inch MA250 Varnish Solid Wood Viola with Case, Bow, Rosin, Bridge and Strings
product_meta.description: Size:16-in.| Color:Natural VarnishMendini viola is completely hand-carved with a solid spruce top and maple back and sides. It is fitted with a maple fingerboard, pegs, and chin rest, and an alloy tailpiece with four integrated fine tuners. This viola includes a lightweight form fitting hard, a Brazilwood bow with unbleached genuine Mongolian horsehair, rosin, and a bridge making this package a great deal for beginners.
feature_bullets: Hand-carved solid spruce top with maple back & sides
Maple fingerboard, pegs, and chin rest with an alloy tailpiece with four integrated fine tuners
Includes: lightweight hard case, a Brazilwood bow with unbleached genuine Mongolian horsehair, rosin, and bridge

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars652 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
